entry.title: Mars Recon­nais­sance Orbiter (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Mars Recon­nais­sance Orbiter photographed Curiosity (pictured) as it landed on Mars?

entry.title: Orangeburg Massacre (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Orangeburg Massacre was the first time police shot and killed students on an American university campus?

entry.title: An Taisce (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that heritage properties cared for by An Taisce include a guildhall, a marsh, a castle, a Quaker cemetery, and Babe's Bridge?

entry.title: David Dayen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that David Dayen, executive editor of The American Prospect, argues in his 2020 book that monopolies are so interwoven with our lives that it is impossible to escape them?

entry.title: dress history (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that much of the research in dress history has been done from documents, illustrations, and photographs rather than by studying items of clothing?

entry.title: Zhu Cilang (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that when Zhu Cilang was asked why his family lost the Mandate of Heaven, he blamed it on their "treacherous ministers"?

entry.title: State Auto Mutual (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that State Auto Mutual's life-size nativity scene was donated to the Museum of Catholic Art and History in 2023 for display at St. Joseph Cathedral?

entry.title: Doppelgangers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Naomi Klein and Naomi Wolf are Doppelgangers?
